member.name: F:Screen2Doc.Hotkey.Empty
member.summary: Represents a Hotkey that has Hotkey.Id set to zero and Hotkey.Data set to System.Windows.Forms.Keys.None.

member.name: M:Screen2Doc.Hotkey.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.param: A unique hotkey id that is in the range 0x0000 through 0xBFFF.
The Hotkey data. This parameter can contain one or combination of Keys.Ctrl, Keys.Alt or Keys.Shift fodifier keys and any key, combined with OR.

member.name: P:Screen2Doc.Hotkey.Alt
member.summary: Gets a Boolean indicating if the ALT key is present.

member.name: P:Screen2Doc.Hotkey.Control
member.summary: Gets a Boolean indicating if the CTRL key is present.

member.name: P:Screen2Doc.Hotkey.Shift
member.summary: Gets a Boolean indicating if the SHIFT key is present.

member.name: P:Screen2Doc.Hotkey.Modifiers
member.summary: Gets the modifiers of the hotkey.

member.name: P:Screen2Doc.Hotkey.Key
member.summary: Gets the key of the hotkey.

member.name: P:Screen2Doc.Hotkey.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the hotkey data. Hotkey data can contain one or combination of Keys.Ctrl, Keys.Alt or Keys.Shift fodifier keys and any key, combined with OR.

member.name: P:Screen2Doc.Hotkey.Id
member.summary: Gets the hotkey id.

member.name: P:Screen2Doc.Hotkey.Name
member.summary: Gets the hotkey name.

member.name: M:Screen2Doc.Hotkey.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified System.Object is equal to the current System.Object.

member.name: M:Screen2Doc.Hotkey.GetHashCode
member.summary: Serves as a hash function for a particular type. Hotkey.GetHashCode is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.

member.name: M:Screen2Doc.Hotkey.ToString
member.summary: Returns a System.String that represents the current Hotkey.

member.name: M:Screen2Doc.Hotkey.ToString(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Returns a System.String that represents the specified Hotkey.
member.param: A Hotkey data. This parameter can contain one or combination of Keys.Ctrl, Keys.Alt or Keys.Shift fodifier keys and any key, combined with OR.

member.name: E:Screen2Doc.HotkeyManager.HotkeyPressed
member.summary: Occurs when a registered hotkey by the HotkeyManager is pressed.

member.name: P:Screen2Doc.HotkeyManager.Hotkeys
member.summary: Gets a collection of hot keys that have been registered by the HotkeyManager.

member.name: P:Screen2Doc.HotkeyManager.Handle
member.summary: Gets the handle to the window associated with the HotkeyManager.

member.name: M:Screen2Doc.HotkeyManager.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.param: A valid window (Form) within the project associated with the HotkeyManager.

member.name: M:Screen2Doc.HotkeyManager.RegisterHotkey(System.Int32,System.Windows.Forms.Keys,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registers an application hotkey.
member.param: A unique hotkey id that is in the range 0x0000 through 0xBFFF.
A Hotkey data. This parameter can contain one or combination of Keys.Ctrl, Keys.Alt or Keys.Shift fodifier keys and any key, combined with OR.
Specifies whether an exception should be thrown after the method fails.

member.name: M:Screen2Doc.HotkeyManager.RegisterHotkey(Screen2Doc.Hotkey,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registers an application hotkey.
member.param: Specifies whether an exception should be thrown after the method fails.

member.name: M:Screen2Doc.HotkeyManager.UnregisterHotkey(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Unregisters an application hotkey that was previously registered.
member.param: A hotkey id. If the function succeeds, the return value is the unregistered hotkey.
Specifies whether an exception should be thrown after the method fails.

member.name: M:Screen2Doc.HotkeyManager.Replace(Screen2Doc.Hotkey,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Replaces the hotkey data for the same hotkey id.
member.param: The hotkey whose data should be replace.

member.name: M:Screen2Doc.HotkeyManager.IsAvailable(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Determines whether a hotkey with the specified hotkey data is available.
member.param: A System.Windows.Form.Keys that represents the hotkey data to be checked. This parameter can contain one or combination of Keys.Ctrl, Keys.Alt or Keys.Shift fodifier keys and any key, combined with OR.

member.name: M:Screen2Doc.HotkeyManager.ContainsId(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether a hotkey with the specified id is registered by the HotkeyManager.

member.name: M:Screen2Doc.HotkeyManager.ContainsData(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Determines whether a hotkey with the specified hotkey data is registered by the HotkeyManager.

member.summary: Converts a HotkeyManager.Modifier to System.Windows.Forms.Keys (modifires).

member.name: M:Screen2Doc.HotkeyManager.ConvertTo(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Converts a System.Windows.Forms.Keys (modifires) to HotkeyManager.Modifier.
member.param: A System.Windows.Forms.Keys that should be converted to a HotkeyManager.Modifier.

member.summary: Unregisters all hotkeys and releases all resources used by the HotkeyManager.
